## WACC with Debt and Equity Mix

```{r}
#| eval: true
#| results: asis
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
library(webexercises)

re <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.12, sd = 0.01)
rd <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.06, sd = 0.005)
tc <- 0.34
we <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.65, sd = 0.05)
wd <- 1 - we
```

Aurora Technologies finances its operations with equity weight **`r round(we*100,1)`**% (cost of equity = **`r round(re*100,2)`**%) and debt weight **`r round(wd*100,1)`**% (before-tax cost of debt = **`r round(rd*100,2)`**%). The corporate tax rate is **`r round(tc*100,0)`**%.

::: {.question-block}

<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault();" style="display:flex;flex-direction:row;gap:6px;">
  <label for="module4_num_q12a"><strong>1. What is the weighted average cost of capital (WACC, in %)?</strong></label>
  <input type="number" id="module4_num_q12a" name="module4_num_q12a" placeholder="Enter value" style="width:150px;"
    data-correct-answer=`r round((we*re + wd*rd*(1-tc))*100,2)` data-tolerance="0.01"/>
</form>

<div id="feedback-module4_num_q12a" class="feedback" style="display:none;">
✅ WACC = wₑ·rₑ + w_d·r_d(1−T_c) = **`r round((we*re + wd*rd*(1-tc))*100,2)`**%.
</div>

:::
